heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 18 October 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (182°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 49.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 6%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 3510 lux) and cloud levels (up 432 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 6434 lux) and cloud levels (up 417 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 431.5m lower than yesterday, 108.7m lower than the past week, 417.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 1111m to a maximum of 2490m, averaging 1181.0m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1289.7m and 1598.3m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, air moisture should feel ok and little or no wind. Chance of light rain, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and low sunlight due to cloudy or overcast skies. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (91%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
